name: Radisson Blu Hotel Altstadt, Salzburg

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the radisson in October 2003. It is without doubt one of the most memorable hotels that we have stayed in. The hotel is small and cosy, and the room we had was remarkable. Lovely old wooden beams spanned the ceiling, and the view of the magnificent fortress from the window was unforgettable. The central location of the Radisson, along the river, was another plus point. The only slight drawback was the lack of food and beverage options, but then there were ample alternatives within walking distance. I would definitely stay at the Radisson again.
reviews.title: What a wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: I was really pleased with this hotel. In the old town, with a door that literally opens into the middle of the pedestrian area. There is no need for a car or even to hire a taxi for anything except maybe to get back to the train station if you have too many bags. The location is excellent. And the property itself, in an old building, is very charming. My room was quiet as the walls, floors and ceilings were quite solid. The bathroom was updated with all you would expect from a 5* hotel. Similarly the bed linens, robes, etc. were all in order. My room was a bit small, but it was a single tho easily could sleep 2). My room overlooked the river (away from the old town/pedestrian area and I would recommend that. While the pedestrian area is the desired area, it gets loud. And you'll be walking around in it all day. No need to spend extra money to come back to your room and look at it/hear it. Also, based on the suggestions of other reviewers I booked on the Raddison site and indeed got a rate of 100 euro a night. Ironically, this was the only 5* hotel I stayed in over a 17 night trip, was certainly the nicest, and was the cheapest! I will absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel for almost 10 years and even celebrated my 21st birthday here (centuries ago) shortly after it opened. I continue to stay here when in Salzburg but for no other reason than the location. The biggest issue this hotel has is its current management - clearly several steps down from the team that used to run it. A reflection of bad management is bad service from disinterested and often scruffy staff. The hotel in the last 3 years has really started to lack its sparkle. The staff are not as good as they could be. Food is fractionally above average. Rooms really need a renovation. Dont get me wrong - this is not a 2 or 3 star hotel. But it really is also not up to international 5 star standards. It could be a gem ...if only it was run properly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in September 2006 before going to Vienna. Salzburg is beautiful. The hotel is in an excellent location. We were able to walk to almost all attractions. Room 202 was huge by European standards, as was the marble bath. Breakfast was good and served in a room overlooking the river. Staff was very helpful. Buying a Salzburg card was well worth the cost.
reviews.title: Very, very nice

likes.disliked: — mini fridge did not keep anything cool

reviews.text: A festival for St. Rupert was in progress during our stay which definitely added to our experience.
reviews.title: Perfect location, fabulous hotel!

reviews.text: Right in the heart of the Altstadt (old town), this charming hotel is perfect for anyone looking to truly explore the best Salzburg has to offer. Right on the far end of a major shopping thoroughfare, the Radisson offers very pleasant staff, great food, and old-world appeal. My room had hard wood floors and double sinks, even though it was a standard room. My friend’s room had cathedral beamed ceilings. The breakfast was VERY satisfying…definitely more than just the regular “continental” breakfast offerings. The beds were a little hard but I like my mattresses that way. I really would not be able to think of a major (or minor, for that matter) problem with this place. For a home base in quaint Salzburg, you cannot go wrong with this pick.
reviews.title: Wonderful Upscale Hotel in an IDEAL Location.

reviews.text: We were initially a little concerned about booking a Radisson, because in Canada and the U.S. they quite frankly are not usually one of the nicer hotel properties. From the moment we arrived, we were happy with our decision.
